section.title: Shell Account
section.para: Each registered user receives its own Unix shell account on the CodeX Shell Account server. You can access your CodeX Shell Account in 2 ways:

tip.title: ** Important Remark **
tip.para: The CodeX Team has established reasonable security measures on the CodeX shell server. By mapping the CodeX permission schema on the Linux permission schema, the data of a given project can only be manipulated by its project members. Any voluntary attempt to crack and/or damage other users or projects account will be considered as a gross misconduct and appropriate penalty will be applied. If you want to exercise your creativity in a useful way do not spend your time cracking CodeX, write clever code and contribute to CodeX instead !

section.para: Whether you use SSH or Telnet, a welcome banner will be displayed right after you log in. This message tells you what are the directories you are allowed to access. Use the Unix "cd" command to change the current working directory. section.title: FTP Storage Spaces
section.para: Each project receives its own FTP storage which is made of 2 distinct zones. The Anonymous FTP Space and the File Release FTP space.

section.title: The Anonymous FTP Space
section.para: The anonymous FTP space can be used by the project members to upload any kind of documents or project data and deliverables they want. It can be accessed by making an ftp connection to projectname.codex.xerox.com. Anonymous users (login "ftp") are granted read-only access whereas project members using their CodeX login and password will be granted read (download) and write (upload) access to this FTP area.

section.title: The File Release FTP Space
section.para: This is where CodeX stores the new file releases uploaded and registered through the CodeX File Release service (see ). Access is granted to project members only in case they want to make modifications by hand. We highly recommend you do not touch this space since it is entirely managed through the CodeX Web interface. If you have questions about your file releases please contact the CodeX Team.
Project members can access this ftp space as follows:

listitem.para: Via your shell account (SSH or Telnet to shell.codex.xerox.com).
Via ftp by connecting to download.codex.xerox.com.

tip.title: **IMPORTANT REMARK**
tip.para: If you registered as a CodeX user before this feature was enabled (on September 4th, 2001) you must enter your password again in CodeX before you can access the shared resources. To do so first login on CodeX and go to http://codex.xerox.com/account/change_pw.php. Then re-type your current password in old and new fields. Click on the Update button and wait for the re-generation to happen (delay shown on the screen).
